title: Simulation/VR-Based Mathematics Course Design for Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematics concepts and experience using digital devices
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining VR simulations and small-group collaborative activities for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields who require mathematical problem-solving skills in their work.

learning_goals: Learners can apply mathematical modeling skills required for real-life problem-solving with over 80% accuracy through VR simulations.

During a mid-term course (2â€“4 weeks), learners can explain two or more complex mathematical concepts (e.g., differential equations, matrix operations) with over 80% accuracy through role division and feedback incorporation processes with peers via two online discussions and one face-to-face collaboration
Learners can systematically analyze mathematical problems in workplace environments and propose solutions through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
